name: TO EARN MORE, LEARN MORE
description:
A course book from the Chicago School of Nursing. Copyright 1925. Property of Miss Carol Cummings of Whitefish, Montana. Compromised of 50 lesson handouts hand bound in a hard cover. 

Interspersed throughout the book are personal letters to the student from her instructors laying out helpful hints, course notes, and a general overview of the next chapter. There's also a sealed envelope containing examination questions with instructions "DO NOT OPEN UNTIL LESSON IS MASTERED AND PUT AWAY". 

I'm always attracted to items like this - with a personal history you can track. Whatever happened to Miss Cummings? Did she graduate? Did she enjoy her career as a nurse? Did she find love? Travel? Did she live a good life? I'll probably never know. But this chance encounter makes me smile.

name: A BOOK OF AMERICANS
description:
Aptly titled poetry book by Rosemary and Stephen Vincent. Really cool illustrations by Charles Child.  Each poem highlights a different character from American history. Pocahontas, John Adams, Lewis and Clark, Crazy Horse, even the USA itself. 

The book opens with the apology:

"We couldn't put in all the great
Or even all the small, 
And many names with sterling claims
We haven't used at all.

But here's a rather varied lot, 
As anyone can see,
And all and each by deed and speech 
Adorned our History.

Some got the medals and the plums, 
Some got their fingers burnt, 
But every one's a native son, 
Except for those who weren't. 

So praise and blame judiciously
Their foibles and their worth.
The skies they knew were our skies, too, 
The earth they found, our earth."

Original copyright 1933. This book is from 1961.

name: BUILD IT YOURSELF!
description:
BUILD IT YOURSELF! A Hundred Good Ideas for Making Your Home More Comfortable, by Michael Rothman. 

This is an awesome little book printed in 1943 by Somerset Books of New York. Its a basic DIY overview covering topics such as making floorplans, planning efficiency corners, how to make work drawings, selecting your wood, tools, fasteners, etc.  A lot of the information is still relevant even with the advancement of power tools. Great for any do-it-yourselfer or avid woodworker.

name: FENDLETON THROW
description:
New take on and old classic. Hand crocheted throw with signature stripes at each end. Super drapey and super comfy. 

About 48" Wide
About 90" Long
(About the size of a single bed)
100% Acrylic
Hand made in Seattle.

name: ROCKEFELLER
description:
Such a stylish little desk calendar! Each new day drops into place with a single rotation of the face. For the life of me I don't know how it works, but it works and I'm ok with that. 

About 2.5" Wide
About 2.5" Tall
About 2" Deep
Made in Japan
